alert.note: Alert for Gage; Jefferson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 6:46PM CDT until April 29 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska, including the following counties, Gage and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beatrice, Fairbury, Plymouth, Diller, Endicott, Jansen, Steele City, Harbine, Cub Creek Recreational Area, Rock Creek Station State Historical Park, Camp Jefferson and Crystal Springs Campground.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
